SCI-FI LABORATORY REMAKE (WIP)

Remaking an old project to a higher standard.


I wasn't happy with how this project was left off so in my free time I am working on improving it.
I am using this as an oppurtunity to practice and improve my Hard-Surface Modelling.



Genre: Horror
Engine: Unity
Development Period: WIP
Platform: PC


ART DIRECTION

Inspiration
Typically, for my projects, they seem to be very modern in setting, or a couple of my projects from 1st and 2nd year were a bit more historical in setting, using castles and more gothic aesthetics, but because of my strong interest in the franchise it really spearheaded my interest in Sci-Fi for this project. Other media such as DOOM, Dead Space, Star Trek and Doctor Who, drove me towards making the environment that I created for this project.
The initial project idea was to create the exterior of a Human Colony on an alien planet, which had been inspired by the Alien Franchise, stretching from the Nostromo Space Ship in Alien (1979), to Hadley's Hope on Acheron LV-426 in Aliens (1986), to Freya's Prospect on BG386 inAliens vs. Predator (Rebellion Developments) in 2010, and lastly to Sevastapol found in Alien: Isolation (SEGA and Creative Assembly) 2014. While I am not overly interested in most Sci-Fi genres, there is something about Alien that really grips me, the whole aesthetic of this franchise really resonates with me.


Inspiration Board

However due to the short amount of extra time I had to dedicate to this project I had to take my initial idea and condense it down to a more managable size given the time period. With this in mind I planned out all of the potential rooms that I could use and this allowed me to remove excess if needed, planning ahead to best suit the time frame that I had for the project.
Applicable for both Space and Dis lmfao.

Environment



Talking about references that helped me create what i did.



More words for the interest.



Interesting words go here.




MIGHT MAKE THIS LIKE "FINAL TOUCHES" OR SOME SHIT.

Unity Implementation
After finalising my 3D models I then exported everything and imported it into Unity.
I created a character controller and began to animate certain key points in the environment to help
the player keep moving and exploring as well as to keep them on edge while playing.

To help introduce a control group to aid with telling how effective the Narrative elements were in
the project, I created a small pop up that would appear showing the player information about certain
objects if they were close to them and also looking in their direction.


SELF-REFLECTION

Areas that I believe that I did well on during the process of this project;

  • With all my projects, I always make the effort to try and learn a new style or technique to help develop my artistic skills within digital art. I was really happy that I was able to learn about some of the techniques used for pixel art creation and that I was able to apply them directly to my work! The Silhouette technique for my pixel art was directly applicable to my concept work in general as a whole.

  • Coming up with alternate solutions when initial ideas failed.

  • Coming up with solutions to having radio silence from groupmates.


    • These are some areas that I believe I could improve upon.

  • Starting off, my biggest issue was scope and figuring out a solid concept that I was going to pursue for my final renders. I knew almost instantly what genre I wanted, however I wasn't sure what I wanted the environment to be. Initially I had been inspired by some of Aliens colony on other planets and also with the Calisto Protocol trailers recently releasing I started off way to large, wanting to create a colony on a frozen planet.
    Eventually this was narrowed down to a spaceship, then down to just a couple of rooms from a space ship, to finally just a lab. Concept work for the bridge and somewhere else was done. However I never had the time to do any of it. If I hadn't wanted to create a such a highly photorealistic environment, I might have been able to create a few rooms and corridors connecting them. However since I was trying to model as accurately and realistically as I could it ate up a lot of my time, time that I did not have since I had spent quite a long time narrowing down my initial scope.

  • Also Since, at the time, I wasn't a huge consumer of the Sci-Fi genre, I didn't quite understand what it was that I was trying to create. I had taken a mixture of many different styles, from modern and futuristic sources for all of the models that I made.
    The result of this is an environment that doesn't know what it's trying to be.
